glyphs.name: CYCLIC
glyphs.description: Continuous circular flow with a right-side arrow bridging a deliberate gap, representing recursive temporal momentum.
design_notes: Arrowhead indicates ongoing momentum, not just a closed loop.
Gap avoids collision with the 'simple circle' topology.
Geometry is tuned for skeleton stability and PSH-256 canonicalization.
Arrow placement is irrelevant due to D4 normalization.

glyphs.name: ERUPTIVE
glyphs.description: A vertical eruption channel with three outward flares, symbolizing upward release of built pressure.
design_notes: Vertical spine represents the eruption conduit.
Three arcs provide directional expansion.
Asymmetry conveys upward force.
D4 invariance ensures orientation independence for the hash.

glyphs.name: STAGNANT
glyphs.description: Horizontal bar representing complete temporal stillness and zero momentum.
design_notes: Pure horizontal line = zero vertical momentum.
Centered position represents balanced stasis.
Substantial length conveys duration of stillness.
Flat line caps intentionally remove dynamism.
Irreducible topology = minimal conceptual state.

glyphs.name: TURBULENT
glyphs.description: Chaotic zigzag representing irregular temporal flow with broken periodicity.
design_notes: Irregular zigzag with variable angles creates unpredictability.
Upward-rightward tilt suggests forward motion through chaos.
Sharp angularity emphasizes disruption.
Avoids symmetry to preserve chaotic semantics.

glyphs.name: DISSIPATIVE
glyphs.description: Downward widening flow pattern representing the dissipation and scattering of energy.
design_notes: Top narrow → bottom wide shows spreading out.
Curved sides communicate loss of structural coherence.
Downward vector = returning to ground state.
Inverse of ERUPTIVE.

glyphs.name: LOW_PRESSURE
glyphs.description: Open circle representing expansive low-density spatial state
design_notes: Bold stroke (2px) distinguishes pressure glyphs from flow glyphs
Open circle = negative space = expansive volume
Perfectly circular = isotropic expansion
No directional bias = balanced low-pressure state

glyphs.name: RISING_PRESSURE
glyphs.description: Half-filled circle representing transitional state of increasing tension
design_notes: Half-fill indicates transitional state (between low and high)
Left-side fill suggests rising from bottom (like liquid level)
Medium stroke weight (1.5px) = intermediate state
Asymmetry indicates directionality and instability

glyphs.name: HIGH_PRESSURE
glyphs.description: Solid filled circle representing maximum density and compression
design_notes: Solid fill = maximum density, no empty space
Bold stroke reinforces visual weight
Circular form = isotropic compression (equal in all directions)
Opposite of LOW_PRESSURE (void vs solid)

glyphs.name: COLLAPSING_PRESSURE
glyphs.description: Concentric circles with core point representing implosive inward collapse
design_notes: Concentric rings suggest shockwaves moving inward
Core dot = singularity point of collapse
Bold strokes emphasize catastrophic energy
Multiple rings = cascading failure
Opposite directionality from ERUPTIVE (implosion vs explosion)

glyphs.name: CRYSTALLINE
glyphs.description: Diamond shape representing ordered geometric structure with high clarity
design_notes: Perfect diamond = crystal lattice structure
Sharp 90° angles = atomic-scale precision
Miter joins emphasize geometric sharpness
Opposite of ORGANIC (rigid vs fluid, angular vs curved)
Evokes: diamond, quartz, ice crystal, mineral facet

glyphs.name: ORGANIC
glyphs.description: Irregular wave representing natural organic flow with soft boundaries
design_notes: Bezier curves create natural flowing form
Variable amplitude suggests biological variation
Rounded joins emphasize softness
Opposite of CRYSTALLINE (fluid vs rigid, curved vs angular)
Evokes: cell membrane, vine growth, water flow, living tissue

glyphs.name: MINIMAL
glyphs.description: Single point representing minimal material presence
design_notes: Single point = irreducible element
Small radius (8px) emphasizes sparseness
Maximum negative space around point
Opposite of DIFFUSE (one vs many)
Evokes: atom, seed, origin point, singular presence

glyphs.name: DIFFUSE
glyphs.description: Scattered dots representing dispersed material distribution
design_notes: 9 scattered points = particle cloud
Irregular spacing prevents grid-like order
Small radius (6px) = particulate scale
Opposite of MINIMAL (many vs one) and CRYSTALLINE (scattered vs ordered)
Evokes: fog, dust cloud, gas dispersion, particle spray

glyphs.name: PEAK
glyphs.description: Upward triangle representing maximum elevation and apex position
design_notes: Sharp point = singularity of maximum
Upward orientation = elevation
Wide base = structural foundation
Opposite of VALLEY (convex vs concave)
Evokes: mountain summit, climax, apex, zenith

glyphs.name: VALLEY
glyphs.description: Downward triangle representing minimum depth and nadir position
design_notes: Sharp point downward = singularity of minimum
Receptive form = collecting/gathering
Wide opening = acceptance
Opposite of PEAK (concave vs convex)
Evokes: river valley, trough, depression, nadir

glyphs.name: PLATEAU
glyphs.description: Elevated horizontal line representing sustained high position
design_notes: Elevated position (Y=200) distinguishes from STAGNANT (Y=256)
Horizontal = zero gradient = sustained
Blunt caps = definite boundaries
Different from PEAK (flat vs pointed)
Evokes: mesa, table mountain, sustained level

glyphs.name: ASCENT
glyphs.description: Rising diagonal representing positive gradient and upward trajectory
design_notes: ~45° angle = strong positive gradient
Left-to-right rise = temporal progression upward
Rounded cap = smooth continuous ascent
Opposite of DISSIPATIVE arrow (diagonal line vs vertical with fade)
Evokes: climb, growth, improvement, rise

glyphs.name: SUBDUCTION
glyphs.description: Curve sliding beneath representing foundational support and structural embedding
design_notes: Subset symbol form = mathematical foundation
Left-opening curve = receptive/supporting
Smooth curve = gradual transition
Evokes: tectonic subduction, foundation, substrate, support structure
usage_examples: ◯⟲∿⊂● — Low-pressure cyclic organic subducting beneath high-pressure

glyphs.name: CONVERGENCE
glyphs.description: Two forms meeting from opposite directions representing bilateral collision and mutual fusion
design_notes: Two turnstile symbols approaching from left and right
Gap between forms = moment before contact
Vertical bars = structural presence of each form
Horizontal bars point toward each other = mutual approach
Evokes: collision, merger, synthesis, meeting point
usage_examples: ◯⊢⊣● — Low pressure converging with high pressure

glyphs.name: OSCILLATION
glyphs.description: Double-headed arrow representing bidirectional alternating exchange
design_notes: Horizontal shaft with arrows at both ends
Equal arrow sizes = balanced bidirectional force
Evokes: pendulum, dialectic, back-and-forth, alternating current
Different from GRADIENT (bilateral vs unilateral)

glyphs.name: GRADIENT
glyphs.description: Directional arrow representing continuous unidirectional transformation
design_notes: Single-headed arrow = unidirectional transformation
Horizontal orientation = temporal progression (left to right)
Most common operator in sequences (A → B → C)
Evokes: causality, process, transformation, becoming

glyphs.name: FUSION
glyphs.description: Overlapping circles representing complete integration and hybrid identity
design_notes: Two circles with significant overlap (vesica piscis)
Overlap zone = new hybrid identity
Equal circle sizes = balanced fusion
Evokes: Venn diagram, nuclear fusion, synthesis, union

glyphs.name: EMERGENCE
glyphs.description: Dot with radiating circle representing generative field and outward radiation
design_notes: Central dot = point source of emergence
Radiating circle = outward propagation of new property
Evokes: birth, genesis, creation, novel complexity arising
Key operator for describing emergent phenomena

glyphs.name: CONTAINMENT
glyphs.description: Concentric circles representing nested boundary and structural protection
design_notes: Two concentric circles = container-contained relationship
Bold stroke (2px) emphasizes boundary strength
Most frequently used operator for complex expressions
Syntax: ⊚(inner_expression) = 'contained within context'
Evokes: nesting, protection, context, scope, enclosure

glyphs.name: VOID
glyphs.description: Empty set symbol representing null state and absolute nullity
design_notes: Circle with diagonal slash = empty set notation
Bold stroke (2px) = logical definitude
Slash negates the circle's containment
Evokes: null pointer, missing data, undefined state, zero presence

glyphs.name: CONDITIONAL
glyphs.description: Lightning bolt representing decision point and conditional branching
design_notes: Lightning bolt = sudden decision/bifurcation
Zigzag path = branching logic (IF-THEN-ELSE)
Bold stroke = definitional clarity
Evokes: decision tree, conditional statement, uncertainty resolution

glyphs.name: NEGATION
glyphs.description: NOT symbol representing logical inversion and boolean reversal
design_notes: Right-angle shape = standard NOT operator
Sharp corners (miter join) = logical precision
Bold stroke = definitive negation
Evokes: boolean NOT, logical complement, inversion operator

glyphs.name: EQUIVALENCE
glyphs.description: Triple horizontal lines representing identity relation and definitional equivalence
design_notes: Three parallel lines = strong equality (not just similar)
Even spacing = balanced comparison
Bold strokes = definitional assertion
Evokes: identity, definition, mathematical equivalence, A ≡ B
